section.p: This manual is a guide for Administrators of . It provides instructions on how to:
section.ul:
Add members to a group,
Manage group members,
Edit group properties (site administrators only), including:
the general properties of the group
the security properties of the group
the moderation of the group
Alter the group size (site administrators only)

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Add members to [Group Name] to open the Add Members page.

section.p: From this page, you may add members to a group in one of three ways:

ul.li: Add existing site members to a group
Create a new group member to add to a group
Create multiple members to add to a group

section.h: Add existing site members to a group

ol.li: Click on Select existing site members to open the Add Members of to [Group Name] page.
Choose one or more members from the list. Use the Control key to select multiple members.
Click the Add button.
Click on Enter the details of a new member to open the Create a New Group Member page.
Fill out at least the Email, First Name and Last Name fields. The Preferred Name field is optional.
You can choose to whether you want to Require member to verify?
Click the Create Member button.

The new member will receive an email message from
containing his or her login details.

tal:block.li: If you have left Require member to verify? ticked, the email will also require the new member to verify their email address. Unless the member verifies, he or she cannot participate in the online group.

section.p: Create Members in Bulk requires a CSV (Comma Separated Values) file. The CSV file must contain at least the first name, last name and email address of each member.

The creation of a large number of members may take a long time, and you may get a timeout. If this occurs, please do not retry until you have confirmed with the groupserver administrator that the members have not been created, otherwise double the number of members may be created. To reduce the chance of this happening, large numbers of users should be created in smaller batches (eg. 100 at a time).
Other profile values can be set at this time. Most of these are self-explanatory. See Viewing Your Profile in The User Maunal.

ol.li: Click on upload the details of multiple members using a CSV file to open the Create Members in Bulk page.
Browse to the location of the CSV file on your local computer.
Set the column header for each user property you have included in your CSV file.
You can choose to whether you want to Require users to verify?
Click the Create Members button.

The new member will receive an email message from
containing his or her login details.

tal:block.li: If you have left Require members to verify? ticked, the email will also require the new member to verify their email address. Unless the member verifies, he or she cannot participate in the online group.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Manage the members of [Group Name], on the Group Administration page, to open the Manage Members page.

If you wish, you may then click on either:
List only the managers of [Group Name] to list only the Managers of the group, or
List only the unverified members of [Group Name] to list only the unverified members of the group (only if there are unverified members).
List only the moderated members of [Group Name] to list only the moderated members of the group (if moderation has been turned on), or
List all posting members to list only the posting members of the group (announcement groups only).

section.p:
From this page, you can:
set the participation coach
set group administrators
set moderators (moderated groups only — see Change Moderation)
set moderated members (moderated groups only — see Change Moderation)
set posting members (announcement groups only)
send verification reminders to unverified members
remove members from the group

ol.li: To set a member as Participation Coach, select the radio button labelled Make [Member Name] the participation coach.
To remove the current Participation Coach, select the radio button labelled Revoke participation coach status from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.
To set a member as a Group Administrator, check the box labelled Make [Member Name] a group administrator.
To remove a current Group Administrator, check the box labelled Revoke the administrator privilages from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.

section.p: In order to set the moderators for a group, moderation must first be turned on. See Manage Moderation.

ol.li: To make a member a moderator, check the box labelled Make [Member Name] a moderator for this group.
To remove a moderator, check the box labelled Revoke moderator status from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.

section.p: In order to set the moderated members for a group, moderation must first be turned on. See Manage Moderation.

ol.li: To moderate a member, check the box labelled Start moderating messages from [Member Name].
To stop moderating a member, check the box labelled Stop moderating messages from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.
To set a member as a posting member, check the box labelled Make [Member Name] a posting member.
To remove a posting member, check the box labelled Revoke the ability to post from [Member Name].
Click the Change button.

section.h: Send Verification Reminder to Unverified Members

ol.li: Click the link labelled Send a verification reminder to [Member Name] to open the Send a verification reminder to [Member Name] page.
Click the Send button.
To remove a member from the group, check the box labelled Remove [Member Name] from [Group Name].
Click the Change button.
Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Edit Group Properties, on the Group Administration page, to open the Edit Group Properties page.

section.p: From this page, you can edit:

ul.li: the general properties of the group
the security properties of the group

section.p: This is where the Online Groups Design is applied to the group.

ol.li: Click on Edit the general properties of the group to open the Edit General Group Properties page.

tr.td: The start of the subject line for email messages sent from the group.
Person or organisation that commissioned the establishment of the group.
The user ID of the Participation Coach.
Text to complete the sentence: "[group_title] is an Online Group for ..."
Text to complete the sentence: "The purpose of [group_title] is..."
The date the group was opened, or will open. Will only be listed on the Charter if Date Closed is also specified.
The date the group will closed, or closed. If left blank, the open and close dates will not be mentioned in the Charter.
What defines the membership of the group, what makes it unique? Text to complete the sentence: "Membership of [group_title] is open to ..."
Items to add to the requirements of participants in the Participation Protocol.
Items to add to the encouraged activites in the Participation Protocol.

ol.li: Click on Edit the security properties of the group to open the Edit Group Security Properties page.

section.p: On this page, you can specify:

ul.li: the group Visibility (who can see this group)
the group Joinability (who can join this group)

section.p: You can set the Visibility so that the existence of the group may be seen by:
You can set the Joinability so that the group can be joined by:

ul.li: Anyone, without approval — anyone can join
Anyone, pending approval — potential group members must apply to join
Only those invited — potential group members must be invited to joined to the group

section.p: To allow Anyone, without approval to join the the group.

ol.li: Set Visibility to either "Only site and group members" or "Everyone".
Set Joinability to "Anyone, without approval"

section.p: This puts the following text on the group homepage:

ul.li: Logged in: "You are not a member of [Group Name]; you can join [Group Name]."
Logged out: "You can register and join [Group Name]."

section.p: To allow Anyone, pending approval to join the the group.

ol.li: Set Group Visibility to either "Only site and group members" or "Everyone".
Set Joinability to "Anyone, pending approval".

section.p: This puts the following text on the group homepage:

ol.li: Logged in: "You are not a member of [Group Name]; you can contact the Participation Coach ([Name]) to request membership.

Logged out:
If you are a member of , log in. Then, contact the Participation Coach [Name] to request membership.
If you are not a member, register. Then, contact the Participation Coach [Name] to request membership.

section.p: Setting Joinability to Only those invited puts the following text on the group homepage:

ol.li: Logged in: "You are not a member of [Group Name]; membership is by invitation only."
Logged out: "You are not a member, and you cannot join, as membership of this group is by invitation only."

section.p: You can set View Files so that files uploaded to the group may be seen by:

ul.li: or Same as group settings to set the visibility of the files to be the same as the visibility settings of the group

section.p: You can set View Messages so that messages sent to the group may be seen by:

ul.li: or Same as group settings to set the visibility of the messages to be the same as the visibility settings of the group

section.p: This page allows you to toggle moderation for the group. To specify moderators and moderated members, see the Manage Group Members section.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Change group moderation, on the Group Administration page, to open the Change Moderation page.

Choose one of
No moderation to allow all members of the group to post without approval, or
Moderate specified members only to select specific members of the group to moderate, or
Moderate specified members, and all new members that join [Group Name] to moderate all new members and any other members that you may specify.
Click the Change button.

section.p: This page allows you to change the size of the group.

ol.li: Click on Group Admin, on your Group's homepage, to open the Group Administration page.
Click on Alter the size of [Group Name] on the Group Administration page, to open the Change the Size of [Group Name] page.
Select your preferred group size.
Click the Checkout button to go to the confirmation page.
Review the summary of changes and cost.
Click the Confirm button to go to Paypal and pay for your new subscription.
